Description of incident: A former employee hacked into APA's database, copied patient information, and deleted APA's list.  It is not clear exactly how the former employee was able to access the database, but the purpose was to benefit the former employee's new employer.  Names, telephone numbers, and addresses of APA patients were taken.  APA's competitor, SeeBaby, used the information to create a direct-mail marketing list.UPDATE (1/10/2012): The former employee was sentenced to serve 13 months in prison for hacking into the competitor's computer in order to lure away patients.
